messages.content:
You are a Gmail data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic email thread data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Gmail schema with:
- threads: array of {id, subject, messages[]}
  - messages: array of {id, from, to[], subject, body, date}

Generate email threads that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace activity)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated emails
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious emails, 1 = indirect/multi-step conversations

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

Generate Gmail thread data from this world_state:

Sub-scenarios (core events):
[
  {
    "id": "planning_meeting_complex_1",
    "type": "planning_meeting",
    "abstract_description": "Alex wants to have a sync meeting next week with Jordan, Sam, Taylor about the Mobile App Launch.",
    "participants_hint": [
      "Alex",
      "Jordan",
      "Sam",
      "Taylor"
    ],
    "constraints_hint": {
      "approx_duration_minutes": 60,
      "time_window": "next_week_working_hours"
    },
    "complexity": "multiple_groups",
    "seed": "planning_meeting_complex_1_seed_001",
    "events": [
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev1",
        "source": "calendar",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:05:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith"
        ],
        "description": "Alex creates a personal calendar entry titled \"MOB Launch: sync topics\" for 2025-11-11 10:30-11:00 as a draft to note discussion points before reaching out to the team.",
        "calendar_event": {
          "calendar_id": "alex_work_calendar",
          "event_uid": "cal_mob_prep_20251111T153000Z",
          "title": "MOB Launch: sync topics",
          "organizer": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "attendees": [],
          "start": "2025-11-11T10:30:00-05:00",
          "end": "2025-11-11T11:00:00-05:00",
          "visibility": "private",
          "status": "confirmed",
          "description": "Prep notes for upcoming Mobile App Launch sync with Eng and R&D."
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev2",
        "source": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:20:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "channel": "DM",
        "description": "Alex DM's Sam asking about Sam's preferred windows for a longer Mobile App Launch discussion early next week, without fixing an exact time.",
        "message": {
          "id": "slack_pmc1_1",
          "text": "Hey Sam, I want to get everyone together early next week for a deeper Mobile App Launch discussion before we lock in the planning milestone. What 1-hour windows work best for you Mon–Wed between 10–4 ET?",
          "thread_root": null,
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_2",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:27:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_sam_williams",
              "text": "Mon is packed. Tues 11–3 ET is mostly open, Wed I can do 10–12 ET. If you can, avoid Wed afternoon — I’m in back-to-back reviews."
            },
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_3",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:30:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_alex_smith",
              "text": "Got it, thanks! I’ll try to land something in that Tue 11–3 ET slot that works for everyone."
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev3",
        "source": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:35:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_taylor_brown"
        ],
        "channel": "DM",
        "description": "Alex checks Taylor's availability in a DM, getting a partially overlapping time window.",
        "message": {
          "id": "slack_pmc1_4",
          "text": "Taylor, I’m trying to pull together a 1-hour Mobile App Launch sync early next week so Eng and R&D can align before we freeze scope. Any 1-hour blocks you like Mon–Wed between 10–5 ET?",
          "thread_root": null,
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_5",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:40:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_taylor_brown",
              "text": "Mon 2–5 ET is doable. Tues is heavier but I can make 2–4 ET work if needed. Wed morning is bad; I’m in interviews."
            },
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_6",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:42:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_alex_smith",
              "text": "Thanks, that helps. I’ll aim for a Tuesday overlap that fits you, Sam, and Jordan."
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev4",
        "source": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:50:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson"
        ],
        "channel": "DM",
        "description": "Alex asks Jordan for availability and hints at Tuesday afternoon as likely.",
        "message": {
          "id": "slack_pmc1_7",
          "text": "Jordan, working on a 1-hour Mobile App Launch planning sync for early next week with you, Sam, and Taylor. What does your Tues afternoon (11/11) look like between 1–5 ET?",
          "thread_root": null,
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_8",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:55:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_jordan_johnson",
              "text": "Nice, I was going to ask about that. Next Tues I’m free 1–3 ET and then again 4–5 ET."
            },
            {
              "id": "slack_pmc1_9",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-03T11:57:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_alex_smith",
              "text": "Perfect. I’ll try to thread the needle around 2–3 ET so it fits everyone."
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev5",
        "source": "calendar",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T13:15:00-05:00",
        "actor": "system_calendar",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams",
          "person_taylor_brown"
        ],
        "description": "Alex creates a tentative hold on their own calendar labeled as a general Mobile App Launch hold, not explicitly called a meeting, to test overlap.",
        "calendar_event": {
          "calendar_id": "alex_work_calendar",
          "event_uid": "cal_mob_hold_20251111T190000Z",
          "title": "Hold - MOB Launch focus block",
          "organizer": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "attendees": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "start": "2025-11-11T14:00:00-05:00",
          "end": "2025-11-11T15:00:00-05:00",
          "visibility": "private",
          "status": "confirmed",
          "description": "Personal focus block reserved for potential cross-team Mobile App Launch sync depending on everyone’s availability."
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev6",
        "source": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:02:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams",
          "person_taylor_brown"
        ],
        "description": "Alex sends an email to Jordan, Sam, and Taylor summarizing the goal and proposing a specific 1-hour slot for the Mobile App Launch sync, but phrasing it as a tentative alignment session rather than a formal meeting.",
        "email": {
          "message_id": "email_pmc1_1@company.com",
          "subject": "MOB Launch – early-week alignment slot",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "sam.williams@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "cc": [],
          "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:02:00-05:00",
          "body": "Hi all,\n\nAhead of the Mobile App Launch \"Planning\" milestone on 11/10 and the \"Development\" kickoff on 11/20, I’d like us to get in the same (virtual) room to align on scope, risks, and ownership.\n\nLooking at everyone’s rough availability, the cleanest overlap seems to be **Tuesday 11/11 from 2–3pm ET**. I’ve penciled that in on my calendar as a focus block for MOB Launch, but I’d like to turn that into a dedicated sync with the four of us (R&D + Eng leads).\n\nCan you confirm if **Tues 11/11, 2–3pm ET** works for you? If not, please reply with conflicts and I’ll find a nearby alternative.\n\nTentative agenda:\n- Quick status on MOB-100 / MOB-101\n- Finalize MVP vs. stretch goals\n- Dependencies and ownership split (R&D vs Eng)\n- Risks / open questions before the Planning milestone\n\nThanks,\nAlex\n",
          "thread": {
            "replies": [
              {
                "message_id": "email_pmc1_2@company.com",
                "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:10:00-05:00",
                "from": "sam.williams@company.com",
                "to": [
                  "alex.smith@company.com"
                ],
                "cc": [
                  "jordan.johnson@company.com",
                  "taylor.brown@company.com"
                ],
                "body": "Works for me – Tues 11/11 2–3pm ET is good.\n\nSam"
              },
              {
                "message_id": "email_pmc1_3@company.com",
                "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:16:00-05:00",
                "from": "taylor.brown@company.com",
                "to": [
                  "alex.smith@company.com"
                ],
                "cc": [
                  "jordan.johnson@company.com",
                  "sam.williams@company.com"
                ],
                "body": "2–3pm ET on 11/11 works on my side as well.\n\nTaylor"
              },
              {
                "message_id": "email_pmc1_4@company.com",
                "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:24:00-05:00",
                "from": "jordan.johnson@company.com",
                "to": [
                  "alex.smith@company.com"
                ],
                "cc": [
                  "sam.williams@company.com",
                  "taylor.brown@company.com"
                ],
                "body": "Confirmed – I’m free 2–3pm ET on Tues 11/11.\n\nJordan"
              }
            ]
          }
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev7",
        "source": "calendar",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T14:40:00-05:00",
        "actor": "system_calendar",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams",
          "person_taylor_brown"
        ],
        "description": "After receiving confirmations via email, Alex converts the personal hold into a shared calendar event for all four participants, clearly indicating it as the Mobile App Launch sync.",
        "calendar_event": {
          "calendar_id": "alex_work_calendar",
          "event_uid": "cal_mob_sync_20251111T190000Z",
          "title": "Mobile App Launch – cross-team planning sync",
          "organizer": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "attendees": [
            "alex.smith@company.com",
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "sam.williams@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "start": "2025-11-11T14:00:00-05:00",
          "end": "2025-11-11T15:00:00-05:00",
          "visibility": "default",
          "status": "confirmed",
          "location": "Google Meet",
          "description": "1-hour planning sync for the Mobile App Launch.\n\nAttendees: Alex (PM, R&D), Sam (Sr Eng, R&D), Jordan (Eng), Taylor (Lead Eng)\n\nGoal: Align on scope and ownership ahead of Planning (11/10) and Dev (11/20) milestones.\n\nAgenda:\n- Current status of MOB-100 (Initial Setup) and MOB-101 (Core Feature)\n- MVP vs stretch goals for launch\n- Ownership split across R&D and Engineering\n- Risks and open questions\n"
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "pmc1_ev8",
        "source": "jira",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-03T15:05:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith"
        ],
        "description": "Alex adds a Jira comment on MOB-101 referencing the upcoming cross-team planning sync time, indirectly confirming the meeting details.",
        "jira": {
          "issue_key": "MOB-101",
          "issue_summary": "Mobile App Launch - Core Feature",
          "comment_id": "jira_pmc1_1",
          "comment_body": "We’ll walk through the open questions on this during the cross-team planning sync next **Tues 11/11, 2–3pm ET** (Alex + Sam + Jordan + Taylor). Outcome will determine which stretch items stay in scope for the initial launch.",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-03T15:05:00-05:00"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    "id": "weekly_report",
    "type": "weekly_report",
    "abstract_description": "PM summarizes weekly wins such as performance improvements and user growth.",
    "metrics_hint": {
      "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
      "users_growth_percent": 10
    },
    "seed": "weekly_report_seed_001",
    "events": [
      {
        "event_id": "wr_ev1",
        "source": "analytics_dashboard",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:45:00-05:00",
        "actor": "system_analytics",
        "participants": [],
        "description": "Export from the mobile analytics dashboard showing week-over-week performance improvements and user growth that Alex later uses in the weekly report.",
        "analytics_snapshot": {
          "dashboard_id": "mob_launch_kpis",
          "time_range_start": "2025-10-31T00:00:00-04:00",
          "time_range_end": "2025-11-06T23:59:59-05:00",
          "metrics": {
            "avg_app_start_time_ms": {
              "previous_week": 2200,
              "current_week": 1870,
              "improvement_percent": 15.0
            },
            "p95_api_latency_ms": {
              "previous_week": 950,
              "current_week": 808,
              "improvement_percent": 14.95
            },
            "weekly_active_users": {
              "previous_week": 20000,
              "current_week": 22000,
              "growth_percent": 10.0
            },
            "new_signups": {
              "previous_week": 5000,
              "current_week": 5500,
              "growth_percent": 10.0
            }
          },
          "export_format": "csv",
          "export_location": "gs://company-data/mob/exports/mob_kpis_2025-11-07.csv"
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "wr_ev2",
        "source": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-07T12:05:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith"
        ],
        "description": "Alex drafts a weekly status email for stakeholders that includes narrative text referencing performance and user metrics but does not explicitly show the raw numbers.",
        "email": {
          "message_id": "email_wr_draft_1@company.com",
          "subject": "Draft – MOB Weekly Update (do not send)",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "cc": [],
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T12:05:00-05:00",
          "body": "MOB – Weekly Update (Draft)\n\nKey wins this week:\n- App performance has improved noticeably; cold start times and key API calls are trending in the right direction.\n- We’re seeing solid week-over-week user growth as we ramp up the beta cohort.\n\nStill need to tighten the wording and add exact percentages before sending to the broader list.\n\nAlex\n"
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "wr_ev3",
        "source": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-07T12:25:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "channel": "DM",
        "description": "Alex asks Sam to sanity-check the performance improvement numbers before finalizing the weekly report.",
        "message": {
          "id": "slack_wr_1",
          "text": "Hey Sam, quick check before I send the MOB weekly update: my read from the dashboard is ~15% improvement in app start time and about 10% user growth WoW. Does that line up with what you’re seeing?",
          "thread_root": null,
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_wr_2",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-07T12:32:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_sam_williams",
              "text": "Yep, that’s about right. For startup we’re ~14.9–15% better depending on the slice, and users are up ~10%. Rounding to 15% perf / 10% growth is fine for the weekly note."
            },
            {
              "id": "slack_wr_3",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-07T12:35:00-05:00",
              "actor": "person_alex_smith",
              "text": "Perfect, thanks. I’ll phrase it that way."
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "wr_ev4",
        "source": "confluence",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-07T13:10:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith"
        ],
        "description": "Alex updates the Confluence page that serves as the canonical weekly status log for the Mobile App Launch, summarizing the same wins that will go into the email.",
        "confluence": {
          "page_id": "CONF-MOB-STATUS",
          "space": "MOB",
          "title": "Mobile App Launch – Weekly Status Log",
          "url": "https://confluence.company.com/display/MOB/Mobile+App+Launch+Weekly+Status+Log",
          "last_modified": "2025-11-07T13:10:00-05:00",
          "section_updated": "2025-11-07",
          "content_excerpt": "Week of 2025-11-07\n\nHighlights:\n- Performance: Client startup and critical API paths improved by roughly 15% week-over-week, reducing perceived load times for beta users.\n- Growth: Active users and new signups grew by about 10% week-over-week as we expanded the beta group.\n- Stability: Error rates remained flat despite the increased traffic.\n\nNext week:\n- Continue performance tuning for the core flows tied to MOB-101.\n- Prepare for the cross-team planning sync on 11/11 to finalize launch scope.\n"
        }
      },
      {
        "event_id": "wr_ev5",
        "source": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-11-07T16:30:00-05:00",
        "actor": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams",
          "person_taylor_brown"
        ],
        "description": "Alex sends the finalized weekly report email to the core Mobile App Launch stakeholders, including the summarized metrics.",
        "email": {
          "message_id": "email_wr_final_1@company.com",
          "subject": "MOB – Weekly Update (week of Nov 7)",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "sam.williams@company.com",
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "cc": [
            "mob-stakeholders@company.com"
          ],
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T16:30:00-05:00",
          "body": "Hi all,\n\nHere’s the Mobile App Launch update for the week of Nov 7.\n\nHighlights\n- **Performance**: We saw roughly a **15% improvement** in key app performance metrics week-over-week (e.g., app startup and critical API paths), which is already noticeable in beta usage.\n- **User growth**: Our beta cohort continued to ramp, with about **10% week-over-week growth** in both active users and new signups.\n- **Stability**: Error rates remained stable despite the increased traffic.\n\nWhat’s next\n- Keep iterating on performance for the flows tied to MOB-101 (core feature).\n- Use next Tuesday’s cross-team planning sync (2–3pm ET) to finalize MVP vs stretch scope for launch and clarify ownership across R&D and Engineering.\n\nThanks,\nAlex\n",
          "thread": {
            "replies": [
              {
                "message_id": "email_wr_final_2@company.com",
                "timestamp": "2025-11-07T17:02:00-05:00",
                "from": "taylor.brown@company.com",
                "to": [
                  "alex.smith@company.com"
                ],
                "cc": [],
                "body": "Nice progress, thanks for the clear summary.\n\nTaylor"
              }
            ]
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
]

Noise scenarios (unrelated events):
[]

People:
[
  {
    "id": "person_alex_smith",
    "name": "Alex Smith",
    "email": "alex.smith@company.com",
    "team": "R&D",
    "role": "PM"
  },
  {
    "id": "person_jordan_johnson",
    "name": "Jordan Johnson",
    "email": "jordan.johnson@company.com",
    "team": "Engineering",
    "role": "Engineer"
  },
  {
    "id": "person_sam_williams",
    "name": "Sam Williams",
    "email": "sam.williams@company.com",
    "team": "R&D",
    "role": "Senior Engineer"
  },
  {
    "id": "person_taylor_brown",
    "name": "Taylor Brown",
    "email": "taylor.brown@company.com",
    "team": "Engineering",
    "role": "Lead Engineer"
  }
]

Parameters:
- noise_level=0.0: Generate minimal noise
- depth=1.0: Make emails highly indirect, requiring multi-step chaining

Target schema:
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "threads": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "id",
          "subject",
          "messages"
        ],
        "properties": {
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "subject": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messages": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "type": "object",
              "required": [
                "id",
                "from",
                "to",
                "subject",
                "body",
                "date"
              ],
              "properties": {
                "id": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "from": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "to": {
                  "type": "array",
                  "items": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                },
                "subject": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "body": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "date": {
                  "type": "string"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Output the complete Gmail JSON now.
